clinical_study.brief_title: Serratus Anterior Block and Erector Spinae Block in Postoperative Analgesia
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Effect of Serratus Anterior Block and Erector Spinae Block on Postoperative Analgesia in Thoracic Surgeries

brief_summary.textblock: 90 patients scheduled for thoracic cancer surgeries, allocated in 3 groups for serratus anterior block and erector spinae block and control group. during anaesthesia:total intraoperative fentanyl required will be recorded. After surgery, all patients will be connected to PCA device containing morphine solution, the amount of morphine consumed during the first 24 hours will be recorded.

detailed_description.textblock: 90 patients scheduled for thoracic cancer surgeries, allocated in 3 groups for serratus anterior block (SAB) and erector spinae block (ESB) and control group. During anaesthesia: total intraoperative fentanyl required will be recorded. After surgery, all patients will be connected to PCA device containing morphine solution, the amount of morphine consumed during the first 24 hours will be recorded. Other secondary outcomes are: numerical rating scales and postoperative pulmonary functions.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: total morphine consumption in first postoperative 24 hours
primary_outcome.description: the amount of morphine required to relieve pain will be recorded

secondary_outcome.description: the amount of fentanyl required during anaesthesia will be recorded
numerical rating scale (from 0 to 10, where 0 represents no pain and 10 represents the worst imaginable pain) will be recorded in different time intervals during the first 24 hours after surgery
FVC and FEV1 will be recorded at 24 hours after surgery

arm_group.description: serratus anterior block with 20 ml bupivacaine
erector spinae block with 20 ml bupivacaine

intervention.description: Patients will receive a sonar guided serratus anterior plane block with 20 ml of bupivacaine 0.5%
Patients will receive a sonar-guided erector spinae plane block with 20 ml of bupivacaine 0.5%
Patients will receive a sham block with 20 ml saline (as a placebo)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with class II physical status (American Society of Anaesthesiologists) ,
- Age between 18-70 years,
- Scheduled for thoracic cancer surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient refusal.
- Local infection at the site of the block.
- Cardiac dysfunction (ejection fraction <45%).
- Significant respiratory disorders.
- Preexisting neurological or psychiatric disease.
- Allergy to one of the study drugs.
- Pregnancy.
- Coagulopathy
